results.title: The Gervasoni Family Estate: life in the Yandoit houses
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maurie Gervasoni’s grandfather settled in Newstead during the Victorian gold rush in the 1860’s and quickly designed and built a family estate. A love of music and dancing made the Yandoit houses a destination for vibrant country living. The stone house and former stables presently sit as a relic, but Maurie hopes that one day the place will be restored to its former glory.

results.title: Accident
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A serious accident brings a tragic end to the dreams and ambitions of a young migrant worker. Looks at the rights of workers and the responsibility of management in industrial accidents. Opens up for consideration the alternatives of Workers Compensation or suing under judge made law.

results.title: The Golden days of Australian radio
results.creator_credit: Bruce Leonard, Bruce Leonard Productions and Film World
results.brief_description: Hilarious performances from the great radio superstars who were household names before the advent of television. Director Bruce Leonard has used his encyclopaedic knowledge of radio history to create a fascinating look at the world of adventure and romance serials and the comedy and music programmes which are a part of everyday Australian’s entertainment heritage. Packed with great gags and stories which have never been seen on video before, the programme reveals some wonderful gems from the likes of Jack Davey, Bob Dyer, Willie Fennell, Mo, Ada and Elsie, Smoky Dawson, Hop Harrigan and many more.

results.title: Lesley
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
A drama based on a real life story, about a runaway girl and an uncaring mother. The film explores the duties of parents to protect their children from danger. Examines the rights of magistrates and judges to control a child’s environment for what is seen to be the child’s benefit. Director of Photography: John Seale

results.title: The Golden age of comedy
results.brief_description: This inspired madness makes the impossible possible by assembling the greatest cast of comedians that ever lived. This film contains the first comedians in their funniest sketches. Compiled from over 2,000 reels, “The Golden Age of Comedy” is a montage of outrageous slapstick humour that marked the highest point in film comedy. It remains a milestone in hilarious amusement and is without doubt the most memorable collection of classic comedy sketches. A must for those who enjoy sidesplitting entertainment. Rated: G

results.title: The Good years of jazz
results.creator_credit: Bernard Rubin, Mike Bryan and Storyville Films
results.brief_description: In the early 1960’s, the Goodyear tyre company comissioned five short jazz films, featuring a handful of the leading musicians of the day in a move that was not purely philanthropic, but which also acted as part of a promotional campaign.

group_works.title: The Louis Armstrong All-Stars
group_works.creator_credit: Bernard Rubin, Mike Bryan and Storyville Films

results.title: Duke Ellington and his orchestra
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Good years of jazz”.
Features one of the most famous jazz musicians of our time, Duke Ellington leads his orchestra in some his most popular hits. These include: ‘Take the A train, satin Doll, Blow by blow, Things ain’t what they used to be, VIP boogie and Kinda Dukish.’ Ample time is given to solo performances by many of the fine soloists.

results.title: The Louis Armstrong All-Stars
results.creator_credit: Bernard Rubin, Mike Bryan and Storyville Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Good years of jazz”.
Recorded in New York City in 1962 as part of a jazz promotion sponsored by Good Year, this film features a great band playing popular jazz standards. Joining Armstrong on trumpet are Trummy Young on trombone, Billy Kyle on piano and the fabulous Jewel Brown on vocals. Armstrong plays “C’est Si Bon”, “Someday”, “Nobody Knows the Trouble I’ve Seen” and a rousing finale of “When the Saints Go Marching In”.

results.title: The Gold bug
results.creator_credit: Robert Fuest, Doro Bachrach and Highgate Pictures
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Edgar Allan Poe’s story of a young boy on a supposedly deserted island who finds a gold bug and an old piece of paper containing a secret code. He then encounters a crazed old man and his mute servant who are searching for Captain Kidd’s buried treasure.
